item.name: 51st State
item.comment: When I saw the cards I knew I would love this game for the arts and climate. Now, I love this game for the mechanics, too! Another Ignacy's great piece of work after Witchcratf :) BIG THUMB UP!

item.name: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
item.comment: Just awesome........... The best balanced game I've ever played. Beautiful, no downtime, excellent combination of fight, economy, risk. no drawbacks for me :) can't wait for the new edition and the builder extension.

item.name: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
Alhambra
item.comment: Simply boring. you build up your own yard, take money, pay money, build again and count how many of a colour you have. it's not a game it's manufacture ;) quick and repetitive.

item.name: Beowulf: The Movie Board Game
item.comment: A great game! I thought it would be boring or something but it turned out to be a really nice strategic game! :) it's very simple, I like the traditional look of the board (squares) and the graphics. it works well especially in terms of interaction. it's quick and feels like a battle. i recommend it :)

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: Maybe strangely, maybe not, but with every game I like it more. When I met it I didn't enjoy it much really. Seemed too simple. But now we play furiously with full range of tactics and it's become a very nice battle indeed. As I said - it's getting better! :)

item.name: Boomtown
item.comment: The best card game - though don't know many yet. Everybody enjoys it. Moreover - far better than Citadels! The aim and cards are similar, but the game is faster and more interesting.

item.name: Brass
item.comment: Never thought I'd fall for an economic game! Sat at the table by chance and that was love in the first sight. Strangely enough, the game is hard to pick up but it's only half of the play that you realise how simple it is, how logical, how easy-going. come on, how could this guy explain the rules for an hour?! the game is great because it doesn't tell you what you do in its course. it just says how it works and everything you do you do your own way. excellent!

item.name: Buccaneer
item.comment: There is not much tactics, no planning, but I like this game. It's sooooo sweet :)

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: Love it with the variant with an undercover cop :) the best traitor motive I know. But even the basic game is great, so psychological and fun! However, you shouldn't sit to this with any personal matters. Most of the times I'm killed very quickly because the rest is usually angry with me...

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: An excellent gateway game. I've infected a few people :D

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy
item.comment: A fantastic game! Although it looks rather poor... and those colours! Nevertheless, we love playing it, it offers a lot of fun and competition. Building your own estate is so well designed! Great job, Mr Feld :) After Macao and In the Year of the Dragon another superb game!

item.name: Caylus Magna Carta
item.comment: With every game I liked it more. Even though I played nearly only 2-player games. I'm not fond of "cubes" games (stuff like wood, food, stone etc.) but this one is not so schematic and boring. the graphics could be better too but didn't bother me either. nevertheless this type is dry as a bone for me, so I wouldn't miss it so much anyway.

item.name: China
item.comment: This is one of those short clever strategic games. Its advantage is an unusual system of scoring where while doing good to yourself you're doing good to others, too and the point is to get much more for yourself and far less for them. However abstract and a bit random it's a pure strategic battle for points. Reaaaaaaly like it :)

item.name: Condottiere
item.comment: Just few plays, have to practice more to check. However, the game has a bad entry. You don't feel how many cards to play in a battle, which can be frustrating.

item.name: Crazy Kick
item.comment: The one I really dreamt of. Could play it for hours. Mostly with my 15-year-old cousin who still loves it. I love it less now. Frankly, just like it... I don't know why (???)

item.name: Cuba
item.comment: Although it seems a limbo-game, i.e. comprising of very different parts (auction, role cards, managing individual boards) it's well premedidated and really made pretty. a FANTASTIC economy game!

item.name: Dixit
item.comment: I hate the graphics :) really hate. besides, after a few times I got the same cards it was hard to come up with some new associations. should be played with different people and between long breaks.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Tomb of the Lich Lord
item.comment: Used to love it deeply... Used to play it every evening after work. the smell of the cards, the magic of the corridors, the sense of adventure. but not all pics nice though. moreover, always played only 1vs1. too much text to remember. would have to play hundred times to get the play go faster (checkicg all these numbers, comparing symbols, reading the tasks). unfortunately I don't want to wait anymore... But I'd like to play with more people one day. maybe it would make my love be back?

item.name: The Golden City
item.comment: This game doesn't seem to make up a whole. it's just like a garment made from different patches. it only pretends to work together. moreover, I don't like the "stand here and take this" mechanism, it's too "childish". generally, a beautiful box holds nothing interesting. looks for me as if the author didn't have any idea for the game.

item.name: Guatemala Café
item.comment: The best made game, the wooden components are simply awesome! it's a bit strange mixture of strategy and economy. too hollow for either. and something's wrong with the scoring. maybe if prolonging the track?

item.name: Guillotine
item.comment: Less strategic than I thought. action cards are played only to pick a certain card, rarely to change any further places in the queue. half of them could have the function "take ...(name)..." instead. not much for thinking though. but the pictures are sweet regardless the topic :)

item.name: Hoity Toity
item.comment: Who could imagine that under that infantile cover there was an excellent game! Met it by chance and have loved it since. Brilliant psychological interaction!

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
Jenga
item.comment: I don't like this kind of games. boooooooring. and too often we come to the point when the tower is perfectly symetric and nothing can be touched anymore.

item.name: Kazaam
item.comment: I was fresh in the industry. And Kazaam seemed cool. Looking good, made well, played with fun. Now I think it's a bit childish.

item.name: Keltis
item.comment: It's sooooo simple and naive and I don't understand why my family and friends love this game so much :/ I like it, but just as a warm-up. Children games used to be like this one. it's too simple for me to appreciate it more.

item.name: Korsar
item.comment: I've got Korsar, the german edition. It's serious, not funny like the American one, has a more elegant looks of the cards and of the box as well. Love this sense of fighting battles! But aren't there too many vessels with gold???

item.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy
The New Era
item.comment: I would never expect i'd think that much playing a card game. I love the complexity, the theme, the engagement. It's an absolutely perfect game for 2 players and almost perfect for 3 and 4 since it just takes too long then. And the more card the better, so I always play with all the cards from 51st State, New Era and now Winter. I'm loooooving it :)!

item.name: Niagara
item.comment: My first :) But unfortunately no one wants to play it any more. They always say "it's a nice game but we'd rather play..." I'm furious!!!!!!

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: I don't like cooperative games, so I bought it to play by myself. And I loved it! every morning I tried to save the world :) I felt like the boss of an emergency team. but time marches on and changes have come.

item.name: Pickomino
item.comment: Like it but downtime sometimes kills. In addition, often it's hard for it to come to an end. it's draging and draaaaging.... tiles constantly come back while the winner is already known. Definitely best with three players.

item.name: Ra
item.comment: An excellent auction game! The best trick about the mechanics is that we bid for both the tiles (which bring points) and the suns (with which we bid in the next round). auctioning of the scoring subject and the tool - isn't it simple and great! the look's also brilliant. I really feel like in Egypt when looking at those tiles with neat graphics. the one thing missing is sand in the box ;)

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Tal der Abenteuer: Die Schatzsuche im Himalaja
Taluva
item.comment: It's wonderful and beautiful :) the volcano looks astonishing! purely strategic. unfortunately, my co-players don't see that in it and I have to play... alone. but this game allows this mode. I can master my tactics however don't know against whom... ;)

item.name: Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization
Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Ticket to Ride: Europe
item.comment: The most beloved game amongst my family and friends. How much time will it take to put me off the game at last? ;)

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment: I'm deeply in love with this game. It's an absolute masterpiece! A tactical competition between empires, battle of strategy, genius and luck. It works perfectly from 2 to 4 players. The range of possibilities to win this war is overwhelming in comparison to actual simple rules. And I love the graphics of the German edition :) Can't live without...

item.name: Tongiaki
item.comment: I've been so impressed by this game! It's so inconscpicuous but it holds all the best: beautiful piece of work, simple rules and fantastic strategic aim. a lot of interaction and positive planning. however there are some drabacks as well: too small tiles, uneven level of fun according to the number of players, planning only possible during your turn, vicious circles on the water ;)

item.name: Witchcraft
item.comment: It's an absolutely wonderful one-to-one battle. I love the mechanics, the colours, the graphics (except for the power tiles). It's a game I looked for: a tactical fight of two groups of individual warriors (in this case - wizzards). Ii resembles chess, but it's far better for me, more interesting, less abstract. And while I don't like chess I LOVE Witchcraft :)
